title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 19 November 2013 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:31 <abusenius> has quit  
00:50 <vmassol> has quit  
01:45 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
01:50 <vmassol> has quit  
02:15 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
02:46 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
02:50 <vmassol> has quit  
03:47 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
03:52 <vmassol> has quit  
04:47 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
04:52 <vmassol> has quit  
05:48 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
05:52 <vmassol> has quit  
06:49 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
06:53 <vmassol> has quit  
07:10 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:12 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
07:12 <vmassol> has quit  
07:16 <vmassol1> has quit  
07:29 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:34 <cjd> has quit  
07:37 <Kaisen> has joined #xwiki  
07:51 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:01 <mflorea> vmassol: Good morning. Unfortunately I cannot release xwiki-commons  
08:02 <vmassol> gm mflorea  
08:03 <vmassol> you know what's wrong?  
08:03 <mflorea> for some reason it builds root pom (xwiki-commons-pom/pom.xml) before license resources from xwiki-commons-tools  
08:03 <mflorea> so it doesn't find it  
08:03 <mflorea> root pom needs it  
08:04 <mflorea> <resourceBundle>org.xwiki.commons:xwiki-commons-tool-license-resources:${commons.version}</resourceBundle>  
08:05 <mflorea> but I have no idea what change has triggered this issue, because xwiki-commons-pom/pom.xm hasn't been modified since the last release  
08:05 <vmassol> you're on a1?  
08:05 <mflorea> yes  
08:05 <vmassol> same maven version?  
08:05 <vmassol> (as before)  
08:05 <mflorea> I don't check the maven version before each release :)  
08:05 <mflorea> I assume its the same  
08:06 <vmassol> just trying to help you  
08:06 <mflorea> 3.0.4  
08:06 <mflorea> now  
08:06 <mflorea> but I don't know the previous version  
08:06 <vmassol> should be the same  
08:06 <mflorea> I can only assume it's the same  
08:06 <vmassol> can you reproduce locally?  
08:07 <mflorea> how? it's happens when you release, otherwise it can find the snapshot dep to license resources because it was previously build  
08:07 <vmassol> empty repo  
08:07 <mflorea> and it happens on release:perform  
08:07 <vmassol> same command line  
08:08 <vmassol> but with dryrun  
08:08 <vmassol> -DdryRun=true  
08:08 <mflorea> there's no dry-run for release:perform, only for prepare afaik  
08:08 <vmassol> http://maven.apache.org/maven-release/maven-release-plugin/perform-mojo.html  
08:09 <mflorea> ok  
08:09 <vmassol> ATM I have no clue  
08:09 <vmassol> of what could be wrong  
08:09 <vmassol> unless some scp failed above in the logs  
08:10 <mflorea> I gave you the entire log :)  
08:10 <mflorea> and, even locally, it will download the snapshot dep from maven  
08:10 <mflorea> I'll try with -o  
08:11 <vmassol> otherwise there's a workaround  
08:11 <vmassol> you do mvn clean install on a1 before retrying  
08:11 <vmassol> but that won't solve the core issue and it would be good to find out the problemm  
08:13 <vmassol> still reading log  
08:14 <vmassol> so indeed prepare worked so 5.3-m2 should be in your local repo  
08:14 <vmassol> could you check that?  
08:14 <mflorea> prepare doesn't build the entire commons  
08:14 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:15 <mflorea> you can see "skipped" for almost all modules, but that's normal  
08:17 <vmassol> btw you've made our passphrase public with pastebin :)  
08:19 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:21 <vmassol> normally the root pom doesn't use the license plugin so it shouldn't need it  
08:23 <vmassol> the first module using is xwiki-commons-core/pom.xml  
08:23 <tmortagne> vmassol: root pom is not really the main issue, all jars require license plugin and its built at the end  
08:23 <vmassol> tmortagne: it should be built just before [INFO] XWiki Commons - Core - Parent POM  
08:24 <tmortagne> it should be built before anything that use it but for some reason maven got lost in dependencies  
08:26 <vmassol> mflorea: I don't know, I would retry if I were you  
08:26 <mflorea> try what?  
08:26 <tmortagne> vmassol: I reproduce it locally with maven install  
08:26 <tmortagne> it's built last  
08:26 <vmassol> hmm?.  
08:26 <vmassol> so it fails in an empty repo and with -o?  
08:27 <tmortagne> I don't see how it would not fail  
08:27 <tmortagne> I have the exact same build order than mflorea had on release  
08:27 <vmassol> yes me too  
08:27 <vmassol> trying with empty repo  
08:28 <tmortagne> can't access jenkins  
08:28 <vmassol> doesn't build  
08:28 <vmassol> but for another reaqon  
08:28 <vmassol> reason  
08:29 <vmassol> trying with -nsu  
08:34 <tmortagne> vmassol: it's perfectly normal that xwiki-commons-pom requires it, that's what makes all our jars inject the license, this is not done in xwiki-commons-core since this is not only about commons  
08:35 <vmassol> where do you see that it requires it?  
08:35 <vmassol> (that's not how it's done)  
08:35 <tmortagne> it has a dependency on it  
08:35 <vmassol> where?  
08:35 <vmassol> I don't see it  
08:35 <tmortagne> it's not because it does not execute it that maven does not validate all dependencies  
08:35 <vmassol> I see only pluginManagement  
08:35 <tmortagne> yes  
08:36 <tmortagne> and maven is supposed to validate pluginManagement  
08:36 <vmassol> and?  
08:36 <vmassol> it works  
08:36 <tmortagne> and it can't find it...  
08:36 <vmassol> no  
08:36 <vmassol> it will not resolve it I believe  
08:36 <vmassol> and it has always worked  
08:36 <vmassol> I can even build locally  
08:36 <vmassol> checking now my build logs  
08:36 <mflorea> maven-remote-resources-plugin is not inside pluginManagement  
08:37 <tmortagne> it obviously does not work  
08:37 <tmortagne> the log Marius got is pretty clear that it does fail and that it's because it could not find the license resource  
08:38 <vmassol> what marius has cannot be reproduced ATM, either on ci or locally  
08:38 <tmortagne> what marius has is a license resource build after everything that needs it  
08:39 <tmortagne> so no I doubt you can build this this issue anywhere  
08:39 <tmortagne> s/this this/with this/  
08:40 <vmassol> indeed there's                 <resourceBundle>org.xwiki.commons:xwiki-commons-tool-license-resources:${commons.version}</resourceBundle>  
08:40 <vmassol> which is not in pluginmgmt  
08:40 <vmassol> the question is: how could it work before?  
08:41 <tmortagne> well the real question is what changed since the version of maven did not changed  
08:42 <tmortagne> xwiki-commons-pom itself does not have any modification since almost a year  
08:44 <vmassol> I know  
08:44 <vmassol> I think  
08:44 <vmassol> yep I know  
08:44 <vmassol> I changed the order of modules un top level pom  
08:44 <vmassol> from:  
08:44 <vmassol>     <module>xwiki-commons-tools</module>  
08:44 <vmassol>     <module>xwiki-commons-core</module>  
08:44 <vmassol> to  
08:45 <vmassol>     <module>xwiki-commons-core</module>  
08:45 <vmassol>     <module>xwiki-commons-pom</module>  
08:45 <vmassol>     <module>xwiki-commons-tools</module>  
08:45 <vmassol> so we need to revert this momentarily for the release  
08:45 <vmassol> and then find a better soslution  
08:45 <tmortagne> that's the only real change in a while so that must be it  
08:45 <vmassol> doing the revet now  
08:45 <vmassol> revert  
08:46 <tmortagne> there is probably a missing dependency somewhere, like on the resource plugin  
08:46 <tmortagne> like we have a dependency on the license check plugin  
08:47 <tmortagne> trying  
08:48 <vmassol> mflorea: done  
08:48 <mflorea> vmassol: ok  
08:49 <tmortagne> works well  
08:49 <tmortagne> committing the fix on xwiki-commons-pom  
08:49 <vmassol> tmortagne: wait  
08:49 <vmassol> I'd suggest after the release no?  
08:49 <vmassol> or you want to try it?  
08:49 <vmassol> let's ask mflorea  
08:49 <vmassol> what he prefers  
08:50 <tmortagne> there is nothing dangerous here, can only be better  
08:50 <tmortagne> I just added a dependency and it build well  
08:50 <mflorea> ok  
08:50 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
08:50 <tmortagne> done  
08:51 <tmortagne> so now you have double fix, you should be ok :)  
08:51 <vmassol> well  
08:51 <vmassol> wait  
08:51 <vmassol> if this fixes it then you need to put back the alphabeitcal order  
08:51 <vmassol> to prove it works  
08:51 <vmassol> and remove my todo  
08:52 <tmortagne> I tested before pulling your change but yes it's useless now  
08:52 <vmassol> I can do it if you prefer  
08:52 <tmortagne> done  
08:52 <vmassol> ok thanks  
08:52 <tmortagne> reviewing all plugins dependencies  
08:53 <vmassol> cool we fixed a bug :)  
08:53 <tmortagne> may not be the only missing one working by luck  
09:00 <mflorea> tmortagne: can I start?  
09:02 <tmortagne> mflorea: yes  
09:03 <tmortagne> am I the only one getting a 403 on https://github.com/ ?  
09:03 <tmortagne> works now  
09:04 <tmortagne> hmm github does not seems to be in a good shape, the UI at least  
09:05 <tmortagne> ssh seems ok  
09:06 <Kaisen> Good morning  
09:06 <vmassol> hello  
09:13 <Kaisen> I have a question concerning to the blog  
09:15 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:26 <Kaisen> If I create a new blog under /xwiki/bin/view/Blog/Management with blog inside an existing space  
09:26 <Kaisen> the blog page is not listet under that space  
09:27 <Kaisen> When I click on the new document/page created I see that it is under Wiki Home  
09:27 <Kaisen> Did I missunderstand the blog inside an existing space function?  
09:28 <Kaisen> I though I can create under each Space an own blog which belongs to that space  
09:30 <vmassol> Kaisen: I think the multiblog feature isn't really working  
09:30 <vmassol> what's working well for sure is a single blog per wiki  
09:30 <vmassol> feel free to raise jira issue for problems you find with the multiblog feature  
09:31 <vmassol> I think we were hesitating about removing that feature or finish implementing it  
09:31 <vmassol> sdumitriu: any take?  
09:31 <vmassol> (having it would be great but I don't know the effort required to finish it)  
09:35 <Kaisen> OK so if the subwiki working with restriction I could use ther the blog per wiki?  
09:35 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:35 <vmassol> Kaisen: yes  
09:35 <Kaisen> Ok so I will wait for an update regarding subwiki and rights  
09:35 <vmassol> that works fine  
09:35 <vmassol> already  
09:35 <vmassol> what you didn't understand is the message  
09:36 <vmassol> when you create a subwiki you choose who can contribute to it by default  
09:36 <vmassol> who can view it is just controlled by wiki permissions  
09:36 <vmassol> you can set that to whatever you wish  
09:36 <vmassol> (in the subwiki admin)  
09:37 <vmassol> we'll make that clearer in the future  
09:37 <Kaisen> Ok so I created a new subwiki.  
09:38 <Kaisen> I set it up that just an admin can invite people  
09:38 <Kaisen> So I have a subwiki with no users in only the admin  
09:39 <Kaisen> I go to the right page and forbid the view edid etc rigths for unregisterd users  
09:39 <Kaisen> Same for the XWikiAllGroup  
09:40 <Kaisen> But all users from my XWiki have still access to the new subwiki  
09:40 <vmassol> no  
09:40 <vmassol> that's not hte way to set up rights  
09:40 <vmassol> please check the doc for that  
09:41 <vmassol> basically you just say which group/users have a given right and whoever doesn't have it ticked will not have it  
09:41 <vmassol> don't use deny  
09:41 <vmassol> (deny/forbid)  
09:42 <Kaisen> Try to find it but get lost someware between multi-tenancy and workspace application  
09:42 <vmassol> just checked our doc and I think it's not good enough. sburjan: it would be great if you could do a pass with manuel?  
09:42 <vmassol> Kaisen: normally the page is http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Access+Rights  
09:42 <vmassol> and there's also  
09:42 <vmassol> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/RightsManagement  
09:44 <vmassol> Kaisen: make sure you set view rights on the group you wish to have it (eg admins) and remove it from the unregistered user  
09:44 <Kaisen> If I use just XWiki as a stand alone I don't have a problem with the RightManagment  
09:44 <vmassol> it should be eaxctly the same  
09:44 <vmassol> a subwiki works like standalone xwiki  
09:44 <sburjan> vmassol: what needs to be improved ?  
09:44 <vmassol> (in term of rights)  
09:44 <vmassol> sburjan: explaining how to set rights  
09:44 <vmassol> I just read it and it seems really bad  
09:45 <vmassol> sburjan: for example it doesn't explain  
09:46 <vmassol> that give a right to a user or group means all other users or groups that don't have it ticked will not have it  
09:46 <vmassol> s/give a right/giving a right  
09:46 <vmassol> it just talkes about denying  
09:46 <vmassol> it also doesn't explain the checkbox to remove all view rights independently of all rights settings  
09:46 <vmassol> etc  
09:46 <vmassol> it's just a mess ATM  
09:47 <vmassol> then it doesn't show tutorial for basic scenarios  
09:47 <vmassol> like open wiki, private wiki, etc  
09:47 <vmassol> with explanations + screenshots  
09:47 <sburjan> please remember that I don't know much about the new rights module  
09:47 <vmassol> since rights are the most complex stuff in xwiki we need to have some perfect doc about it  
09:47 <vmassol> nothing to do with new rights module sburjan  
09:47 <Kaisen> It takes a while for me to understand but in the end I understood and I can configure it  
09:48 <sburjan> Ok. I'll try to make it better, but I don't have time this week because I am waiting for the release  
09:48 <sburjan> going to talk with Manuel about this  
09:48 <Kaisen> But for the subwiki it seems all users have standard access to a subwiki  
09:48 <vmassol> ok thanks sburjan  
09:48 <vmassol> Kaisen: if you think there's a bug please file a jira issue with explanations on how to reproduce and someone will look at it  
09:49 <Kaisen> Ok so I will go that way  
09:49 <Kaisen> I have one other quesiton. What let you guys move to use Jira?  
09:50 <vmassol> what are the viable alternatives?  
09:50 <vmassol> (open source ones even)  
09:50 <vmassol> :)  
09:50 <vmassol> we didn't find any  
09:50 <vmassol> (especially 7 years ago)  
09:50 <Kaisen> I don't know but I already looking for some  
09:50 <vmassol> but even now, I don't know any  
09:51 <vmassol> if there was a good issue tracking tool and open source today that perfectly knows how to import from jira we could use it  
09:51 <Kaisen> I just know the normal ones like redmine, mantis, bugzilla etc  
09:51 <Kaisen> I'm fine with Jira  
09:52 <Kaisen> Makes totaly sence to me to use it  
09:52 <vmassol> so far they're kind enough to give us free license so we're continuing  
09:52 <vmassol> :)  
09:52 <vmassol> we even wanted to develop an xwiki app for issue tracking at some point but it's a lot of effort ;)  
09:52 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:57 <Kaisen> Whould be nice but the questions is how extensive you will do i  
09:57 <Kaisen> t  
10:16 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:19 <cjd> IMO it depends on what you need  
10:20 <cjd> JIRA has zillions of tools for building pretty graphs and measuring and managing and so on  
10:20 <cjd> for some projects, an equivilant to github's issue tracking is enough  
10:23 <vmassol> the problem is always the evolution  
10:23 <vmassol> when you build something that is not your core business you loose  
10:23 <vmassol> because the others progress fast and you don't  
10:23 <vmassol> look at xwiki's wysiwyg editor for ex  
10:24 <vmassol> it's been stagnating for years now  
10:24 <vmassol> but ckeditor is progressing fast for ex  
10:24 <cjd> yup  
10:24 <cjd> I was making the comment regarding "what is a good bug tracker"  
10:25 <cjd> ckeditor is good except that the build process is closed source so if you need to change anything you're screwed  
10:25 <vmassol> http://dev.ckeditor.com/  
10:26 <vmassol> http://dev.ckeditor.com/wiki/SVN  
10:26 <cjd> there's a .jar file which is used to build it  
10:26 <cjd> I suppose you could use a java decompiler on that jar file  
10:27 <vmassol> you mean not all of ck is under the LGPL?  
10:27 <vmassol> http://ckeditor.com/about/license  
10:27 <cjd> I'm not sure about the licenses but what I know is you need this .jar file to build it and you can't have the source to that file  
10:27 <vmassol> that would be a violation  
10:27 <vmassol> looks dubious  
10:28 <cjd> http://docs.ckeditor.com/?\_escaped\_fragment\_=/guide/dev\_build#!/guide/dev\_build  
10:31 <vmassol> seems they're on github too: https://github.com/ckeditor  
10:31 <cjd> yeah, it's the ckbuilder.jar which is a little scary  
10:32 <vmassol> I'm sure it could be foudn but in any case it's not the final product so not a big deal  
10:32 <cjd> I looked pretty carefully and was not able to find it  
10:32 <vmassol> did you ask them?  
10:32 <cjd> I didn't  
10:33 <cjd> might be a good idea before getting involved in it  
10:33 <cjd> the only concern is having to patch it to fix a nasty bug and getting blind sided by that one piece of closed source code...  
10:38 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:42 <vmassol> cjd: http://ckeditor.com/forums/Support/Where-are-the-sources-for-CKBuilder  
10:44 <cjd> awesome, thanks  
11:06 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:06 <tmortagne> evalica: note that this page is par of http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Repository+Application so any change needs to be put on git too  
11:08 <evalica> tmortagne: yeah sure- the thing is that I cannot reproduce locally so it's a xwiki.org problem - that's why I'm testing on e.x.o directly  
11:09 <tmortagne> evalica: I don't say you should not test on EXO, just remaining you to keep the git version up to date  
11:09 <tmortagne> I always work on exo too  
11:09 <evalica> k  
11:38 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: Hi  
11:39 <gdelhumeau> each time I save a document during a migration (I mean the migration of the database launched the first time you access the wiki), I have the following stacktrace: http://hastebin.com/yahiwevoqe.java  
11:39 <mflorea> Hi gdelhumeau  
11:39 <gdelhumeau> It's during an upgrade from 4.5.4 to 5.3-SNAPSHOT  
11:42 <gdelhumeau> more simple: http://hastebin.com/micoqinaco.java  
11:43 <mflorea> gdelhumeau: are you sure you get it when you save a page? It comes from the Solr indexing threads which work in the background.  
11:43 <evalica> has quit  
11:43 <gdelhumeau> yes, when I save the document (I'm using the debugger), this log appears  
11:44 <mflorea> which page are you saving?  
11:44 <tmortagne> mflorea: it looks like it's when he save a page for him but it's actually executed in a different thread  
11:45 <tmortagne> (the solr thread)  
11:45 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <mflorea> yes, that's what I told him, I doubt it's triggered by page save  
11:45 <tmortagne> well it is  
11:45 <tmortagne> when you save the page it's added to solr queue  
11:46 <tmortagne> so it is triggered by page save  
11:46 <tmortagne> just it's in another thread  
11:46 <mflorea> only if the queue is empty  
11:46 <mflorea> that's why I asked him what page he saves  
11:46 <tmortagne> the queue is empty most of the time after the first indexing anyway  
11:46 <mflorea> the log is about myworkspace:XWiki.XWikiAllGroup  
11:46 <mflorea> sure  
11:46 <mflorea> but my question is does he save the page that appears in the log  
11:47 <mflorea> myworkspace:XWiki.XWikiAllGroup is not just any page  
11:47 <mflorea> does it reproduce for any plain wiki page?  
11:47 <mflorea> on any wiki  
11:47 <tmortagne> it's during migration  
11:47 <mflorea> or it's just about that page or that wiki  
11:47 <tmortagne> so a kind of special state regarding xcontext and things like this  
11:48 <tmortagne> according to the stack trace look like there hasn't been any xcontext defined already and it end up null in the provider  
11:48 <gdelhumeau> mflorea: I have saved myworkspace:XWiki.AdminUsersSheet for example  
11:48 <tmortagne> I don't think it's about the page itself but more the fact that solr try to index a page before the first xcontext is done initializing  
11:49 <gdelhumeau> and yes, I also save myworkspace:XWiki.XWikiAllGroup  
11:51 <gdelhumeau> and this is what happens when I then start the DW to do the upgrade of the main wiki: http://hastebin.com/lukanirugo.java  
11:52 <gdelhumeau> (which is not the same pb)  
12:03 <evalica> has quit  
12:15 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:38 <Slashman\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:41 <Slashman> has quit  
12:45 <Slashman\_> has quit  
12:51 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
12:56 <mflorea> has quit  
13:24 <sburjan> sdumitriu: ping  
13:32 <tmortagne> note: I just upgraded all the jenkins jobs to jdk1.6.0\_45 and maven 3.0.5  
13:32 <tmortagne> I did not tested much maven 3.1.x yet but we should probably start to look at it in details  
14:14 <cjd> has quit

18:25 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: problem with main wiki descriptor is that it's pretty much impossible to generate a useful one automatically  
18:26 <tmortagne> it always need user to set at least the proper alias/domain  
18:27 <tmortagne> also note that this descriptor is used only for external URLs and if you enabled xwiki.virtual.failOnWikiDoesNotExist
